definition: Li Shizhen (1518-1593), Ming botanist and pharmacologist, author of Compendium of Medical Herbs 本草綱目|本草纲目[Ben3 cao3 Gang1 mu4]

sentences.english: At the same time, Li Shizhen Medicine Innovation Award is presented at first.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，李时珍医药创新奖也在会上首次颁发。

sentences.english: Compendium of Materia Medica recorded 9 kinds of medical amphibians can be used as medicine.
sentences.chinese: 明代李时珍《本草纲目》一书记载药用两栖类9种。

sentences.english: Li Shi Zhen believed that soybean energy "blood circulation, Xie Zhudu".
sentences.chinese: 李时珍认为，黄豆能“活血，解诸毒”。

sentences.english: But Li Shizhen did not abandon, new collect is herbal, fill write note.
sentences.chinese: 但李时珍没有放弃，又重新搜集草药，补写笔记。

sentences.english: Li Shizhen(1518–1593), was one of the greatest physicians and pharmacologists.
sentences.chinese: 李时珍是最伟大的医学家和药理学家之一。

sentences.english: Because his home schooled, Li Shizhen enjoyed medicine from childhood.
sentences.chinese: 由于家庭的熏陶，李时珍从小就喜爱医药。

definition: Compendium of Medical Herbs 1596, compiled by Li Shizhen 李時珍|李时珍[Li3 Shi2 zhen1]
Shennong's Compendium of Materia Medica, a Han dynasty pharmacological compendium, 3 scrolls

Baopuzi, collection of essays by Ge Hong 葛洪[Ge3 Hong2] on alchemy, immortality, legalism, society etc
traditional Chinese medical science/a doctor trained in Chinese medicine
